User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/enter_bug.cgi?product=Thunderbird&format=guided

When search search messages with "X-Spam-Flag is YES" in my folder "Spam".
3 occurances found.

When search search messages with "X-Spam-Flag is not YES" in my folder "Spam".
207 occurances found.

207 messages with "X-Spam-Flag:YES" are in my folder "Spam".

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
> edit > search > search news
Search messages with "X-Spam-Flag is YES".
Search messages with "X-Spam-Flag is not YES".

Actual Results:  
"X-Spam-Flag is YES" 3 hits.
"X-Spam-Flag is not YES" 207 hits.

Expected Results:  
"X-Spam-Flag is YES" 207 hits.
"X-Spam-Flag is not YES" 0 hits.

All 207 messages my folder "Spam" have the Header "X-Spam-Flag:YES" set.


I use an IMAP account.
Global search is active.
All messages are stored offline too.

There is no difference if I mark "Search on Server" or not.

My older thunderbird version 2.0.21 finds 207 hits of "X-Spam-Flag:YES" but has no option "is not".
